Key Match Events: Gavin Williams pitched seven sharp innings, allowing one run and one hit.
Lane Thomas and Josh Naylor each hit two-run homers for Cleveland.
Emmanuel Clase handled the ninth for his 41st save, converting 28 consecutive save chances.
Post-Match Reflections: Gavin Williams mentioned 'Filling up the zone' and having a better plan with catcher Bo Naylor.
Guardians manager Stephen Vogt commented on Williams' performance, noting his adjustment after the first couple of innings.
Royals infielder Michael Massey reflected on the team's current losing streak, mentioning bad luck with ball placement.
Lane Thomas expressed satisfaction in contributing to the team's success.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals played without manager Matt Quatraro, who missed the game due to a personal matter.
Kansas City finished with two hits in its season-high sixth consecutive loss.
Bobby Witt Jr. served as the designated hitter for the first time since last September 4, ending a span of 161 games at shortstop.
Royals' 1B Gurriel left in the eighth due to right hamstring tightness.
